Module 2: Navigating the eBook K-8 Collection

Resource Content

To support educators with the efforts of introducing young students to the knowledge, skills, and career options available to them, the Michigan Career Development Model (MCDM) was created. This model was “designed to provide all students (K-12) in the Michigan educational system with the necessary knowledge and skills for success in a career of their choice and lifelong learning.” For elementary students, the MCDM suggests various activities to expose students to a broad spectrum of career zones.

Building Your List

The eBook K-8 Collection provides hundreds of eBooks that can help introduce students to various types of careers and are easily aligned to the MCDM six career zones identified by MDE.

  • Arts and Communications
  • Business, Management, Marketing, and Technology
  • Engineering/Manufacturing and Industrial Technology
  • Health Sciences
  • Human Services
  • Natural Resources and Agriscience

Using these career zones as your advanced search topics will help you narrow your results. The next activity invites you to take a closer look at using the advanced search option to find content connected with these career zones.

DELETE BELOW

  • Building Your List

To build lists of your own or create a lesson around a specific career, it’s important to narrow the search results. Here are two ways you to help narrow your search results:

  1. Search titles associated with all jobs & careers and connected to reading levels for lower and upper elementary students.

  2. Set more specific criteria by using the “advanced search” filters for topics and reading levels. The MeL eBook Search Tool document can help you add Lexile groups and offers some search suggestions.

  • Sharing Resources

Later in this module, you will have an opportunity to explore content that showcases the results of using advanced search topics and reading level filters as described above.

Once you find the resources you plan to use, MeL has created multiple ways to share these resources with your students, including

  1. Search titles associated with all jobs & careers and connected to reading levels for lower and upper elementary students.

  2. Set more specific criteria by using the “advanced search” filters for topics and reading levels. The MeL eBook Search Tool document can help you add Lexile groups and offers some search suggestions.

For additional information on how to access, search, and share this content, check out these detailed eBook K-8 Collection instructions.
